p: Despite the low fatality rate caused by Covid-19 compared with other earlier coronavirus epidemics produced by SARS-CoV and Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV), diabetic and obese people are at a high risk ( Yang et al., 2020). Recently, it has been reported that diabetes is an important risk factor for the progression and adverse outcome of Covid-19 and more attention must be paid to diabetic, obese, and hypertensive patients, particularly considering the rapid deterioration ( Bloomgarden, 2020; Guo et al., 2020). Therefore, adequate information about the relationship between Covid-19 and metabolic syndrome is required for better management of these patients.
